title: Model Denial of Service
description: Model Denial of Service (DoS) occurs when resource-intensive operations cause the system to become unavailable or degrade performance. Attackers can exploit this by sending large prompts, rapid requests, or resource-intensive queries that exhaust system resources.
detection_patterns: No rate limiting on LLM requests

mitigations.implementation: Use rate limiting middleware to restrict requests per user/IP. Implement sliding window or token bucket algorithms.
Set maximum request processing time and terminate long-running requests. Implement circuit breakers for degraded service.
Limit tokens per request, total tokens per session, and concurrent requests per user.
Enforce maximum prompt length and response size limits to prevent resource exhaustion.

references.title: OWASP LLM Top 10 - LLM04: Model Denial of Service
